title: 'Did not want to...': Pak def min gives absurd excuse for army's failure to withstand Op Sindoor
content: Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif has made a bizarre claim that Pakistani forces deliberately avoided intercepting Indian drones to conceal strategic military locations. This justification follows India's 'Operation Sindoor,' precision strikes on terrorist spots, and the thwarting of Pakistani drone and missile attacks.

title: Blackouts & Pak's failed attacks: 10 things that happened in last 36 hrs
content: Tensions escalate between India and Pakistan as India launches 'Operation Sindoor' targeting terrorist camps in response to the Pahalgam attack, neutralizing over 100 terrorists. Pakistan retaliates with drone and missile strikes, prompting India to counter-attack key military bases. Blackouts, curfews, and air raid warnings grip the region, with the IPL suspended amidst the ongoing conflict.

title: 'Buzdil' PM can't even take Modi's name: Pak MP slams Shehbaz Sharif
content: Pakistan's parliament witnessed heated debates as ministers clashed over the government's handling of the escalating conflict with India. MP Shahid Khattak criticized Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif for his perceived inaction and failure to condemn India and Prime Minister Modi. This occurred after India conducted precision strikes in PoK following terror attacks in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: IPL 2025 suspended for one week with immediate effect, confirms BCCI
content: The BCCI has suspended IPL 2025 for one week, effective immediately, due to recent events. This decision, impacting matches like Lucknow Super Giants versus Royal Challengers Bengaluru, follows concerns from franchisees, broadcasters, and sponsors. The board expressed solidarity with the nation, armed forces, and the government amidst ongoing challenges, prioritising national interest above all else.

title: 'Invoke emergency powers under civil defence rules': MHA to all states, UTs
content: Amid escalating India-Pakistan tensions, the home ministry has directed states and Union territories to implement civil defence measures under the 1968 Act. This directive follows Pakistani drone and missile strikes in Jammu and Kashmir and Rajasthan, retaliating against India's Operation Sindoor, which targeted terrorist sites after the Pahalgama attack. Indian air defence systems successfully intercepted most threats.

title: Elon Musk’s X: Indian govt has asked us to block 8,000 accounts, however...
content: X (formerly Twitter) has received orders from the Indian government to block over 8,000 accounts, including those of international news organizations and prominent users, citing violations of local laws. X has complied by withholding the accounts in India but disagrees with the government's demands, viewing it as censorship and a violation of free speech.

title: Nifty, Sensex plunge over 1% as India-Pak tensions weigh
content: Operation Sindoor impact on Indian stock market today: Stock market indices Nifty and Sensex declined significantly by over 1 per cent on Friday amid escalating tensions between India and Pakistan.

title: '1971 war was not remotely as terrifying': Residents of border areas shell-shocked
content: Poonch endured intense Pakistani bombardment, unlike anything experienced even during the 1971 war, prompting widespread fear and displacement. Shelling damaged religious sites and homes, resulting in casualties, including a tabla player, a kirtan singer and a maulvi. Residents are now fleeing, seeking safety as they express the urgent need for civilian bunkers amidst escalating tensions.

title: Govt empowers Army chief to mobilise Territorial Army for support
content: Amid escalating tensions with Pakistan, the defence ministry has granted the Army Chief expanded authority to mobilise the Territorial Army. This decision, enabled by Rule 33 of the Territorial Army Rules 1948, allows for the deployment of Territorial Army units to bolster security and support regular army operations across various commands.

title: Operation Sindoor: Govt shares important Dos and Don'ts for internet users
content: Following Operation Sindoor, MeitY issued an advisory for Indian internet users, emphasizing responsible online behavior and caution against misinformation. The advisory outlines dos and don'ts, including sharing verified information and avoiding posts inciting violence. The Ministry of Information & Broadcasting has also advised OTT platforms to discontinue content originating from Pakistan in the interest of national security.

title: Watch: Indian Army defuses projectile-like object in Amritsar
content: Tensions escalate as the Indian Armed Forces defuse a projectile in Amritsar following reported Pakistani air strikes along the western border in Jammu and Kashmir and Punjab. The Indian Army responded to ceasefire violations and drone attacks, asserting its commitment to national sovereignty. These events follow heightened tensions after the Pahalgam terror attack and India's subsequent Operation Sindoor.

title: IPL 2025: 'We will blast your stadium' - DDCA receives threat email
content: The Delhi and District Cricket Association (DDCA) received a threatening email on Friday morning, warning of an imminent explosion at the Arun Jaitley Stadium. The stadium, which serves as the home ground for the Delhi Capitals, was scheduled to host an IPL 2025 match between DC and Gujarat Titans on May 11.

title: India proposes cutting tariff gap to clinch trade deal with Trump
content: India has proposed significantly reducing its tariff differential with the US to under 4% to secure exemptions from existing and future tariffs. This move aims to boost the $129 billion bilateral trade, currently favoring India with a $45.7 billion surplus.

title: Jeff Bezos loses World's Second-Richest man title to one of his biggest competitor
content: Mark Zuckerberg's fortune has surged past Jeff Bezos, making him the world's second-richest person, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. This shift occurred as Meta's shares outperformed Amazon's, with Meta reporting strong first-quarter revenue. Meanwhile, Elon Musk remains the wealthiest individual, boosted by increased Tesla shares following his commitment to reduce time spent on government duties.

title: Watch: BSF foils infiltration bid by terrorists along Pakistan border
content: On the night of May 8, 2025, the BSF successfully thwarted a major infiltration attempt by Pakistan along the International Border in Samba district, Jammu and Kashmir. Simultaneously, the Indian Army reported that Pakistan's armed forces initiated multiple drone and munition attacks along the western border and engaged in numerous ceasefire violations along the LoC.

title: 'Look who’s behind him': Indian envoy shows photo as proof of Pak's link to terrorism
content: Indian High Commissioner Vikram Doraiswami confronted Pakistan on Sky News, displaying a photograph of Pakistani military officials attending the funeral of terrorists killed in India's Operation Sindoor. He highlighted the presence of UN-designated terrorist Hafiz Abdur Rauf, brother of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief, leading funeral prayers. Doraiswami questioned Pakistan's system of giving state funerals to terrorists, emphasizing the message it sends.

title: 'No need to panic': Indian Oil dispels shortage fears as tensions with Pak escalate
content: Amid rising India-Pakistan tensions, Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) assured the public that there is no shortage of petrol, diesel, or LPG. This statement follows panic buying fueled by social media posts showing long queues at fuel stations, particularly in border states.

title: Fully intact, undetonated Chinese PL-15 missile found in Hoshiarpur
content: Following the interception of missiles and drones fired by Pakistan, remnants of a missile were discovered in Punjab's Hoshiarpur. Initial reports suggest the recovered missile might be a Chinese PL-15, potentially launched from a Pakistani JF-17. If confirmed, India could gain valuable insights into its technology, enhancing its defense capabilities and strategic advantage against China.

title: PIB trolls Pak with 'Golmaal' jibe as Islamabad seeks 'loans', then retracts
content: The Press Information Bureau (PIB) mocked Pakistan's government after its Economic Affairs Division seemingly appealed for more international loans due to losses from conflict. While Pakistan claimed the account was hacked, Moody's warned that escalating tensions with India could negatively impact Pakistan's growth and financial stability. Moody's anticipates minimal impact on India, except for increased defense spending.

title: Can Pakistan afford a war with India? Here's a reality check
content: India-Pakistan tensions impact: Escalating tensions with India pose a significant threat to Pakistan's fragile economic recovery, potentially derailing its IMF bailout program and access to international financing. Pakistan's vulnerability stems from its high external debt, limited foreign exchange reserves, and reliance on international aid.

title: IPL suspended: Which window can be used to complete the remaining 16 matches?
content: Following the one week suspension of the IPL 2025, India's tour of Bangladesh and participation in the Asia Cup later this year are now highly improbable. The BCCI might utilise the August-September window to conclude the IPL if required, even if it means cancelling the scheduled tour and Asia Cup participation.

title: When was the last time IPL stopped midway?
content: The IPL 2025 has been suspended due to escalating regional tensions and national security concerns following missile firings by Pakistan. The decision impacts the final 16 matches, with BCCI prioritising player safety after an earlier game postponement and airspace closures. Evacuation efforts are underway, with potential rescheduling options being explored for later in the year.

title: India-Pakistan tensions: What’s closed, emergency protocols & more
content: Amid escalating tensions between India and Pakistan, states bordering the neighboring country are implementing emergency measures. Delhi has heightened security and cancelled employee leaves, while Punjab, Jammu and Kashmir, Haryana, Rajasthan, and Himachal Pradesh have closed educational institutions following drone attacks.

title: Pak missile, drone attack foiled: How India's S-400 'Sudarshan Chakra' works
content: India's S-400 air defense system, known as "Sudarshan Chakra," successfully intercepted a Pakistani offensive involving drones and missiles. S-400 air defence system, with its extensive range and engagement capabilities, neutralised all incoming threats from Pakistan.

title: IPL teams make travel plans after league suspended
content: The IPL 2025 has been suspended due to heightened regional tensions between India and Pakistan following missile firings by the latter, all of which were successfully intercepted by the Indian defence forces. The fixture between Punjab Kings and Delhi Capitals was postponed on Thursday.

title: Pakistan appeals for loans citing 'heavy losses', later says X account hacked
content: Pakistan's Economic Affairs Division faced a social media controversy after a post, later claimed to be a hack, appealed for international loans amid escalating tensions with India. This occurred following India's "Operation Sindoor" in response to a terrorist attack, leading to retaliatory strikes and market instability, with the Karachi Stock Exchange plummeting.

title: L-70 guns, Schilka, S-400: Weapons India used to intercept Pak drones
content: On May 8-9, 2025, Pakistan's armed forces initiated multiple drone and munition attacks along the western border, accompanied by ceasefire violations along the Line of Control in Jammu and Kashmir. The Indian Army effectively repulsed these attacks, responding firmly with advanced weaponry and air defense systems. India also used S-400 missile systems to neutralize incoming threats.

title: 'With every decision taken ... ': Rohit Sharma to Indian Forces
content: Indian cricketer Rohit Sharma voiced his support for India's military actions against terror infrastructure in Pakistan, emphasizing national pride and urging caution against fake news. This statement followed India's strikes on terror targets in response to the Pahalgam attack, escalating tensions between the two nations. The match between Punjab Kings and Delhi Capitals in Dharamsala on Thursday was called off due to security concerns.

title: 'Bombs are coming': Cheerleader's terrifying video from PBKS vs DC match
content: BCCI is in a huddle after the match between Punjab Kings and Delhi Capitals was called off midway due to the cross-border tensions. The players and spectators were asked to evacuate the venue immediately and now the Indian cricket board has planned a special train to get the players, support staff and broadcast crew to safe zone.

title: Watch: Army releases video of its strong response to Pak amid drone attacks
content: Tensions have escalated along the western border as the Indian Army released footage of a Pakistani drone being shot down. This action follows a major assault by Pakistani Armed Forces involving drones, missiles, and ceasefire violations across Jammu and Kashmir. Indian forces repulsed the attacks, responding with force after Operation Sindoor targeted terror camps in retaliation for a prior attack.

title: Body found hanging in train toilet of Ahmedabad–Kolkata Express in MP
content: A passenger, estimated to be between 30 and 35 years old, was discovered deceased in a toilet aboard the Ahmedabad-Kolkata Express at Sagar railway station in Madhya Pradesh on Thursday. The train was temporarily stopped, and authorities are working to identify the victim, who was traveling in a general coach.

title: Bill Gates to donate 99% of his wealth— What will his children actually inherit?
content: Bill Gates, the tech billionaire, plans to donate 99% of his wealth to the Gates Foundation within 20 years, aiming to dissolve it by 2045. He wants to address urgent global issues, foregoing the label of 'dying rich.' Despite his $168 billion fortune, his children will inherit less than 1% to encourage their own success.

title: ‘Shoot to kill’ orders issued, Mumbai fishermen warned to stay away from oil rigs
content: Following heightened security concerns and recent drone attacks along the border, Maharashtra has issued 'shoot to kill' orders for unauthorized entries into offshore defense zones. The Fisheries Department urgently warned coastal fishermen to avoid oil rigs and restricted areas, providing no-fishing coordinates.

title: Air raid sirens blare in Ambala over possible Pakistan attack
content: Ambala residents were alerted to a potential attack from Pakistan as air raid sirens blared across the city at 10:22 am, prompting authorities to urge people to stay indoors. This warning follows heightened tensions after Operation Sindoor and mirrors a similar alert in Chandigarh on Friday, which suspended work at the Punjab and Haryana High Court.

title: No 'fidayeen' attack, no strike on port: PIB counters fake news flooding social media
content: The Press Information Bureau's Fact Check Unit has debunked a fake video circulated by Pakistani handles, falsely claiming the destruction of an Indian post. The PIB clarified that the video was staged propaganda, noting the non-existent "20 Raj Battalion.

title: 'Let's do our part': Neeraj Chopra's powerful message amid rising India-Pakistan tensions
content: Chopra, the double Olympic medallist in javelin, is set to compete at the Ostrava Golden Spike 2025 athletics meet on June 24 in the Czech Republic. After being forced to withdraw from the past two editions due to injury, he will finally aim to make his debut at the prestigious meet.

title: Drones, blackouts and sirens: What happened overnight in Jammu, Punjab and Rajasthan
content: Following heightened tensions and India's response to terror attacks, Jammu experienced explosions and a blackout early Friday, with security forces neutralizing threats. Simultaneously, Punjab and Rajasthan enforced blackouts amid reports of drone activity and explosions, prompting heightened security measures and investigations.

title: S-400, Spyder, Akash: India’s air defence systems explained
content: In a significant escalation, Indian armed forces successfully intercepted and neutralized over 50 swarm drones launched by Pakistan along the Line of Control and International Borders on May 8-9, 2025. The coordinated drone attacks and ceasefire violations were met with a robust response, utilizing advanced air defense systems.

title: Conflict widens, India targets Lahore, Pindi, Karachi after foiling multiple Pak attacks
content: Following escalating hostilities, India retaliated against Pakistan, targeting air defense systems and other strategic sites after thwarting missile and drone attacks on Indian military bases and civilian areas. Operation Sindoor is underway, with India responding to Pakistan's aggression with targeted strikes and forward deployments. The international community watches as tensions rise between the two nations.

title: Army foils Pakistan attempts to send swarm drones across LoC
content: On the night of May 8-9, 2025, the Indian Army successfully intercepted and downed over 50 Pakistani swarm drones attempting to breach the LoC and International Borders. This comprehensive counter-drone operation involved advanced weaponry and specialized counter-UAS equipment across multiple sectors. The attacks followed Indian precision strikes in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir under 'Operation Sindoor'.

title: Evacuate now! IPL Chairman rushes onto field during PBKS vs DC match
content: Amid escalating India-Pakistan tensions, IPL chairman Arun Dhumal directed spectators to evacuate the Dharamsala stadium, leading to the abandonment of the Punjab Kings versus Delhi Capitals match. A floodlight failure halted the game after 10.1 overs, despite a dominant 122-run opening partnership by Punjab. Players and staff will now travel to Delhi via a special train from Pathankot. A video now viral on social media captures Arun Dhumal walking onto the field and urging the crowd to exit the stadium immediately.

title: Pakistan Super League officially relocated to UAE after tensions escalate
content: The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has announced the relocation of the remaining Pakistan Super League (PSL) matches to the United Arab Emirates (UAE). PCB Chair Mohsin Naqvi expressed disappointment that Pakistani fans would miss watching the games live.

title: India-Pak tension: PM tells top officials to remain alert, ensure essential supplies
content: Following the successful air-strikes in Pakistan, Prime Minister Modi directed key secretaries to ensure the readiness and security of essential systems. He emphasized seamless coordination among ministries for operational continuity and instructed proactive action on supply chains and infrastructure security. Departments are closely monitoring commodity prices and combating misinformation to maintain stability during potential escalations.

title: 'Ironman' Edwards brushes off injury to lift Wolves
content: Anthony Edwards overcame a scary-looking ankle injury in the second quarter and scored 13 of his 20 points after halftime to lead the Wolves to a Game 2 victory.

title: Draymond upset with 'agenda' after drawing tech
content: Warriors star Draymond Green, who received his fifth technical foul of the playoffs Thursday night, expressed frustration over what he called an "agenda" to make him out to be an "angry Black man."

title: Vegas laments missed call in G2 loss to Oilers
content: Just when it appeared that the Vegas Golden Knights finally found an opening in overtime, their chances of winning Game 2 were quickly closed shut in controversial fashion.

title: Caps rave about Wilson's G2 spark: 'Set the tone'
content: Tom Wilson's clutch Game 2 Eastern Conference playoff series performance drew rave reviews from teammates, with Alex Ovechkin calling him the team's leader for providing a little bit of everything for the Capitals.

title: Irked Devers tells Red Sox he won't switch to 1B
content: Rafael Devers said the Red Sox approached him about the idea of filling in as Boston's first baseman but said it's not in his best interest to make another position switch.

title: Texans rookie Higgins makes history with deal
content: Texans rookie wide receiver Jayden Higgins has become the first second-round pick in NFL history to receive a fully guaranteed contract.

title: Report: Pacers' Haliburton warned for G2 dance
content: Tyrese Haliburton received a warning, not a fine, for his celebration after the Pacers' Game 2 win at Cleveland in the East semifinals Tuesday, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.

title: Sources: Pacquiao, 46, to unretire for title shot
content: Boxing star Manny Pacquiao, who retired nearly four years ago, will return to the ring in July to face Mario Barrios for his WBC welterweight title, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: ⚾ Cubs or Sox for Pope Leo XIV?
content: The Cubs and White Sox paid tribute to recently elected Pope (and Chicago native) Leo XIV amid a fandom debate.

title: Top prospects for the 2025 NHL draft: Updated rankings after U18s, draft lottery
content: There's a consensus on the top four -- after that, all bets are off. Who will your team select in June?

title: Five surprising MLB performances -- and why they're happening
content: We break down a breakout bat, a prospect finally coming into his own, a power hitter who has stopped hitting home runs, and more.

title: Power Rankings: Tigers make top-5 debut as Mariners, Royals are on the rise
content: While NL powerhouses duke it out at the top, a new club is leading the way in the AL, with two others also on the up.

title: The biggest remaining roster hole for every NFL team: Where all 32 could still upgrade
content: Teams have added to their rosters through free agency, trades and the draft, but they all have at least one position that still needs a boost.

title: NFL experts debate the draft: Which midround picks could be fantasy sleepers?
content: A dozen experts weigh in on the draft with their top picks, Rookie of the Year predictions and fantasy sleepers.

title: What should we expect from Shedeur Sanders in Cleveland?
content: Fifth-round draft picks don't typically carry the weight of expectations. Ahead of his first NFL practice, what's realistic for Sanders in a Browns uniform?

title: At long last, Michigan State aligns with Larry Nassar survivors
content: Nassar survivors and MSU president Kevin Guskiewicz announced a new assessment of the school's culture.

title: Post-spring Way-Too-Early Top 25: Where do Texas and Notre Dame rank?
content: Where do the top teams stand after spring practice and roster movement from the transfer portal? Mark Schlabach updates the rankings.

title: GM is the new gold rush for college football
content: The general manager position is exploding in college football as more and more NFL personnel get involved.

title: Projecting how good the expansion Valkyries will be in their inaugural WNBA season
content: Historically, WNBA expansion teams have struggled in their first season. How many games might Golden State win in 2025?

title: One game from glory, Postecoglou is doing it the "anti-Spursy" way
content: Ange Postecoglou's Tottenham side have had a rollercoaster of a Europa League, but can they finally win their first major trophy in 17 years?

title: Man United reach final, but hardly look up to the task
content: Man United played poorly enough to remind everyone why they need the Europa League to save their season.

title: Champions League final: Inter or PSG? Our experts make their picks
content: ESPN writers gaze into their crystal balls to predict who will be crowned European champions at Munich's Allianz Arena on May 31, Inter or PSG.

title: Man Utd, Spurs advance to all-English UEL final
content: Manchester United and Tottenham Hotspur will meet in the Europa League final on May 21, after both sides sealed wins in their semifinal ties on Thursday.

title: Ange hits back: People 'fear' Spurs might win final
content: Ange Postecoglou has hit back at anyone who tries to "diminish" his side's achievement of reaching a European final, adding that he "couldn't care less" about the club's Premier League form.

title: Amorim: Trophy 'least we can do' for United fans
content: Ruben Amorim said Manchester United owe their fans a trophy after booking their place in the Europa League final.

title: Antony goal helps set up Betis final with Chelsea
content: Abde Ezzalzouli emerged as Real Betis' hero on Thursday after he netted an extra-time winner to make them the first Spanish side to reach the Conference League final, setting up a showdown with Premier League side Chelsea.

title: Beckham, Neville complete Salford City takeover
content: Salford City have been acquired by a new ownership group led by former England internationals David Beckham and Gary Neville, who were already investors in the club.

title: Man United great Evra's MMA debut postponed
content: Former France and Manchester United player Patrice Evra's mixed martial arts debut has been postponed.

title: Kerr, Mewis announce birth of their first child
content: United States women's national team midfielder Kristie Mewis and her partner, Chelsea striker Sam Kerr, have announced the birth of their first child.

title: Haaland blames lack of 'hunger' for poor season
content: Erling Haaland has said there are no excuses for Man City's season and said it has happened because he and his teammates "haven't been good enough."

title: King of TikTok: 'LeBron James' song sparks trend
content: A new phenomenon: R&B songs composed solely of LeBron's and Steph Curry's names are taking over TikTok.

title: Setting records and continuing a legacy: CJ Kirst is carrying on his family name
content: CJ Kirst is just the latest Kirst to make a name for himself and is leading Cornell into the NCAA tournament.

title: Betting buzz: Bettors sticking with Celtics despite Knicks' 2-0 lead
content: Despite dropping the first two games, bettors are still picking the Boston Celtics in their series against the New York Knicks.

title: Stanley Cup playoff odds: Rantanen new Conn Smythe fave after hat trick
content: Every playoff team's odds to win the 2025 Stanley Cup and favorites for the Conn Smythe Trophy for playoff MVP.

title: How NASCAR drivers keep their cool in 140-degree cockpits
content: NASCAR cockpits can reach 140 degrees, so how do drivers keep cool? The answer is liquid-cooled clothing.

title: Pound-for-pound rankings: Inoue retains spot, Canelo falls after lackluster performance
content: Where do Naoya Inoue and Canelo Alvarez land after winning their fights this past weekend? Here are the latest ESPN P4P rankings.

title: The ultimate guide to your draft
content: André Snellings provides a blueprint to follow for fantasy women's basketball drafts including his ideal selections in each round.

title: Raleigh in fantasy's top 25? Webb destined for Cy Young? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: Clásico kits: Barcelona, Real Madrid's all-time best, worst jerseys
content: El Clásico is a clash of two of the world's most recognizable teams, Barcelona and Real Madrid. Both have iconic kits and shocking shirts in their closets.

title: Ancelotti's Real Madrid limbo explained: Why he could leave, and what comes next
content: As Carlo Ancelotti prepares for what appears to be his final Clásico, how could his last few weeks play out?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Cunha prefers Man United over Arsenal
content: Wolves forward Matheus Cunha is interested in Man United. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Delhi airport sees cancellation of 138 domestic, international flights on May 9
content: Delhi International Airport Limited advised passengers to be prepared for additional time at security checkpoints and cooperate with airline and security staff for smooth processing

title: Unidentified object resembling bomb discovered in Rajasthan’s Jaisalmer district
content: Police said the investigation was in progress and it was not yet known if the object was live or destroyed

title: Order permitting shops, establishments in T.N. to remain open 24x7 on all days extended till 2028
content: The State government on Thursday (May 8, 2025) issued the necessary orders in this regard, amending the Tamil Nadu Shops and Establishments Act, 1947

title: Kerala SSLC Class 10 results declared; 99.5% pass rate
content: As many as 61,449 students secured A+ certification in all subjects. Kannur district secured the highest pass percentage

title: T.N. government sanctions ₹150 crore for Namakku Naame Thittam for 2025-26
content: The G.O. issued by the Rural Development and Panchayat Raj Department also framed guidelines for the implementation of the programme for 2025-26

title: Andhra Police step up security at all sensitive places amid growing tension at India-Pakistan border
content: Police increase security due to escalating tensions between India and Pakistan; vigilance at airports, shrines, and borders

title: Supreme Court tags PIL for reviewing five-year law courses with pending plea
content: A Bench of Justices Vikram Nath and Sandeep Mehta, which refused to issue notice in the matter, agreed to hear the plea along with the other similar petition

title: Mangaluru-Thiruvananthapuram Vande Bharat Express to run with 16 coaches from May 22
content: Initially operating between Kasargod-Thiruvananthapuram Central, the service was extended to Mangaluru Central in March 2024

title: Congress takes out Tiranga Yatra in support of Indian armed forces
content: A large number of party leaders and workers marched with the national flag, expressing solidarity with the security forces

title: War not a solution, countries must resolve matters through dialogue: AIMPLB amid India-Pakistan tensions
content: The All India Muslim Personal Law Board said there is no place for terrorism in Islamic teachings, globally recognised principles and human values.

title: T.S. Tirumurti and M.K. Narayanan talk on international community’s reaction to Pahalgam terror attack
content: “They talk of Islamophobia, anti-semitism but don’t acknowledge Hinduphobia which was what Pahalgam was,” says Mr. Tirumurti

title: No need for panic buying: Oil companies assure public of ample fuel stocks
content: Help us serve you better by staying calm and avoiding unnecessary rush. This will keep our supply lines running seamlessly and ensure uninterrupted fuel access for all, says Indian Oil Corporation

title: Two killed, five injured in road accident in A.P.’s Krishna district
content: The tractor in which the victims were travelling overturned when the driver was reportedly trying to take out the mobile phone from his trouser pocket, according to an eyewitness.

title: Army jawan from Sathya Sai district killed in Pakistan firing at LoC
content: Grief engulfed the impoverished tribal community in Kalli Thanda and surrounding hamlets, as news of Naik’s death spread across the district in the morning.

title: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh reviews security situation with CDS, 3 service chiefs
content: The meeting was attended by Chief of Defence Staff Gen Anil Chauhan, Army Chief Gen Upendra Dwivedi, Air Chief Marshal A P Singh, Navy Chief Admiral Dinesh K Tripathi and Defence Secretary Rajesh Kumar Singh

title: Defence Ministry urges media to refrain from live coverage of security operations
content: The Ministry emphasised that revealing such sensitive information could compromise operations and put lives at risk, citing past incidents like the Kargil War, the 26/11 attacks, and the Kandahar hijacking

title: Watch: “The destruction of Pakistan should be the end of this war,” says M.K. Narayanan
content: When asked what would India’s ‘nuclear option’ in terms of war with Pakistan, Mr. Narayanan urges caution

title: Ambedkar statue uprooted by miscreants in Madhya Pradesh; attempt to take it away unsuccessful; police on guard
content: The statue was desecrated, prompting police to deploy personnel at the site; officials say the culprits would be arrested soon

title: Maharashtra seeks to increase share in divisible tax pool; requests allocation of ₹1,28,231 crore to fund infra projects
content: Hailing Maharashtra’s fiscal policy, 16th Finance Commission chairman Dr. Arvind Panagariya said, “The State’s finances appear to be in good state with low fiscal deficit and borrowings within the limit of 3% set by the Centre

title: Operation Sindoor: Pakistani media twisting the truth, says I&B Ministry
content: Flagging the “grossly exaggerated claims”, the I&B MInistry said nearly all major Pakistani news channel such as “Geo News, Dunya News, ARY News, and SAMAA TV have been repeating the same unverifiable, inflated claim: that the Pakistan Air Force has shot down Indian drones”.

title: Teenager dies of rabies in Kerala’s Alappuzha
content: The boy was reportedly attacked by a dog two weeks ago. According to preliminary information, he did not take anti-rabies vaccine

title: India-Pakistan tensions: Samajwadi Party president Akhilesh Yadav calls for restraint and responsible behaviour from citizens
content: The former Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister appealed to avoid spreading any unconfirmed reports, warning that such content could be part of the enemy's strategy to create unrest

title: We are at war with terrorists: Indian Ambassador to U.S. Vinay Kwatra
content: “Pakistan’s belief lies in perpetrating these proxies of terror killings, brutal killings of innocent civilians,” he said

title: Nine militants arrested in Manipur
content: “Four active members of the banned Kangleipak Communist Party were apprehended from Lamding Khumanthem Leikai in Thoubal district on May 8, 2025,” police said

title: T.N. announces helpline for its students in Jammu and Kashmir
content: Stalin instructs authorities to ensure the safe return of T.N. students in Jammu and Kashmir; over 40 students from the State are studying in various institutions in J&K

title: J&K Congress slams Pakistan for targeting Jammu, says it will pay for its sins
content: J-K Pradesh Congress Committee strongly condemns the provocative and escalatory actions of Pakistan by launching drone and missile attacks in Jammu city and other parts last night, says party's chief spokesperson

title: Why did Tamil Nadu ban mayonnaise made from raw eggs?
content: Mayonnaise made of raw eggs is a high-risk food as it carries a risk of food poisoning, especially from Salmonella bacteria, Salmonella typhimurium, Salmonella enteritidis, Escherichia coli, and Listeria monocytogenes

title: Computer-savvy visually impaired student scores 486 in Class 12 Board exams
content: M. Anand is the first visually impaired student to write the State board Class 12 exams on a computer

title: Air sirens sounded in Chandigarh; residents advised to remain indoors amid escalating tension
content: The sirens were sounded across the city as a precautionary measure, and all were advised to remain indoors and away from balconies, according to a message issued by the Deputy Commissioner, Chandigarh

title: Malayalam actor Vinayakan arrested for drunk, disorderly behaviour; released later
content: Vinayakan had been staying at the hotel in Kollam since May 2 as part of a move shoot nearby and during checkout on Thursday, he created a scene at the establishment while intoxicated, say police

title: T.N. CM Stalin to lead rally in support of Indian army on May 10
content: The rally to be led by Mr. Stalin at 5 p.m. on May 10 would be commence from the office of the Director-General of Police and conclude at the War Memorial

title: Considering Abu Salem’s early release, Maharashtra tells High Court
content: In his plea, Abu Salem, the extradited gangster, claimed he had already undergone the 25-year imprisonment term if the remission for good behaviour was included.

title: Elaborate arrangements being made for Modakondamma Festival at Paderu
content: ASR District Collector asks the officials to ensure effective crowd management and hassle-free darshan for all devotees during the three-day festival

title: Pakistan attacks with drones, munitions along western border effectively repulsed: Indian Army
content: The developments followed the precise missile strikes carried out by the Indian armed forces on nine terror targets in PoK and Pakistan early Wednesday under Operation Sindoor, in retaliation for the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack

title: Simhachalam temple wall collapse: Missed writing on the wall
content: In the early hours of April 30, on Akshaya Tritiya day, a newly built wall collapsed on devotees queueing up for darshan at the Sri Varaha Lakshmi Narasimha Swamy temple in Simhachalam, crushing seven people to death and injuring many. As stunned kin demand answers, details of neglect of the temple’s infrastructure and oversight in festival arrangements emerge, write B Madhu Gopal and Harish Gilai

title: Out of tune: Hindustani great Gangubai Hangal’s childhood home in Dharwad in a state of neglect
content: Although Gangubai moved to Hubballi at the age of around 14, she had her childhood memories attached to the Dharwad house

title: Soaring school fees turn private education into a luxury in Bengaluru
content: Many parents complain that the annual increase in school fee does not seem to follow any logical pattern. The government, meanwhile, does not appear to be keen on regulation

title: Gossip, dreams, and courtroom drama: Theatrenama brings small-town stories alive
content: Written and directed by Sandeep Shikhar, the play, according to the synopsis by the team, is set in Advocate Mukherjee Street in a North Indian town and revolves around the hair-cutting saloon run by the protagonist, Bachchan

title: SIT conducts searches Jagan Mohan Reddy’s PA’s house in liquor scam
content: Enforcement Directorate officials ask SIT to submit details of liquor scam, to probe under Prevention of Money Laundering Act, 2002

title: When lives fall through the cracks of an unregulated elevator system
content: As Hyderabad’s vertical ambitions soar, so do chilling tales of neglect hidden behind painted walls and polished lobbies. From toddlers to professionals, fatal lift accidents are laying bare gaping holes in regulation, oversight and everyday safety. In a city obsessed with speed and scale, safety has become an afterthought. Lavpreet Kaur charts the disasters that are flying under the radar

title: Over 2,000 security personnel, veterans join solidarity rally for Indian armed forces
content: Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy, IT Minister D. Sridhar Babu, Transport Minister Ponnam Prabhakar along with other senior political representatives also joined the rally

title: Is academic freedom a made-up concept?
content: In the backdrop of Trump’s moves on Ivy League institutions in America, a look at the scope and limitations of freedom on campus, and why it’s not always easy with institutions being pulled in different directions

title: Do restaurants have the right to charge a service fee?
content: Is the service charge, typically ranging from 5% to 20% across restaurants, a legitimate business practice or an unfair burden on consumers? Why is the issue mired in litigation?

title: Two lakh palm trees identified for Neera production in Bihar
content: An incentive amount will be given to 20,000 toddy tappers at the rate of ₹8 per litre of Neera  produced directly to their bank accounts

title: Chhattisgarh girl scores 99.17% while overcoming cancer; tops State board
content: Ishika missed the board examination last year after being diagnosed in October 2023; her family says that while she has always done well academically, this difficult phase strengthened her resolve

title: COMEDK-UGET to be held across 28 States on May 10
content: Since it is an all-India level examination, the dress code for the COMEDK 2025 exam will be in line with what is advocated by the respective State Governments: COMEDK

title: IRCTC terminates contract with vendor after company staff manhandle passenger on train
content: A penalty of ₹5 lakh was imposed on the company and an FIR lodged by the Government Railway Police (GRP), Kathua

title: War a distraction, will devastate Punjabis and Kashmiris: Farmers’ outfit
content: They warned that Indian strikes inside Pakistan could trigger a full-scale war, the consequences of which will be borne heavily by the people

title: U.S. to stay out of war that's none of our business: Vance on India-Pak tensions
content: Mr. Vance quoted U.S. President Donald Trump and Secretary of State Marco Rubio who have said that Washington wants the tensions to "de-escalate" as quickly as possible

title: Karnataka’s MMR reduces to 63 per lakh live births, but is still highest among southern States
content: The six-point decline in Karnataka is the highest among southern States, followed by Tamil Nadu where MMR has reduced by five points. Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, and Kerala have shown a reverse trend with an increase in MMR by one or two points

title: A silent burden: Thalassaemia patients in Karnataka battle disease with hope and hardship
content:
Access to public health for patients with blood disorders like thalassaemia has improved over the years, but it still remains fragmented and inconsistent. Most families spend thousands every month for the long-drawn treatment, and the only permanent curative option is beyond the reach of most, finds Afshan Yasmeen. 
May 8 is observed as World Thalassaemia Day.

title: Blackout enforced in Punjab districts; drones neutralised in Jalandhar
content: In Jalandhar, some drones were spotted that neutralised at around 11.20 p.m. by security forces, as per official sources

title: Operation Sindoor LIVE: Object resembling bomb discovered in Jaisalmer district
content: The central government has empowered the Army Chief to call out “every officer and every enrolled person” of the Territorial Army to provide for essential guard or to be embodied to support or supplement the regular Army.

title: Odisha to make its roads ‘disaster resilient’ as part of ₹1000 crore project
content: The government will raise road embankments above flood level, provide protection walls and stone pitching works, to prevent erosion, and also cross drainage structures

title: Amidst concerns around voter discrepancies, EC publishes ‘revised’ electoral roll for Bengal’s bypoll-bound Kaliganj
content: Two byelections in West Bengal are due — in the Kaliganj Assembly constituency and the Basirhat Parliamentary constituency — following the recent deaths of their respective legislators.

title: Bombay HC upholds gangrape conviction, throws out past sexual relationship defense
content: Bombay High Court condemns shaming of gangrape survivor, reaffirms no consent based on past relationships, convicts upheld

title: Indo-Pak tension: Punjab, Haryana, Chandigarh on alert mode
content: Government personnel leaves cancelled; schools in six border districts of Punjab to remain shut until further orders

title: Fill up High Court judges’ vacancies expeditiously, SC tells govt
content: The Bench was hearing a case highlighting the need to ease the process of bail, especially for undertrials; the court was concerned with the fact that there were over seven lakh criminal appeals pending in the High Courts

title: All educational institutes closed for two days in J&K: govt.
content: Decision comes after parts of Jammu region witnessed drone and missile attacks from Pakistan; CM Omar Abdullah says govt. will decide on May 12 regarding reopening

title: If Rohingya refugees are ‘foreigners’ under the Foreigners Act, they will be dealt with as per the law: SC
content: Petitioners say persons identified as ‘refugees’ by the UNHCR have constitutional protection against deportation to Myanmar; S-G Tushar Mehta submitted that India was not a signatory to the UN Convention on Refugees

title: Two days of intense, substantive conversations on several critical fields at The Hindu Huddle
content: After a five-year pause, The Hindu Huddle has returned to Bengaluru as a marquee event of The Hindu Group

title: When sirens sound and bugles call
content: Reporters from Punjab and Rajasthan, both of which have borders with Pakistan, and the National Capital Region talk to civilians — regular citizens, members of the civil defence and emergency services — to understand preparedness and their experiences with the drills and blackouts that have come on the back of Operation Sindoor

title: X says it blocked 8,000 accounts in India after govt's executive orders
content: The platform said it received executive orders from the government requiring it to block over 8,000 accounts ‘subject to potential penalties including significant fines and imprisonment of the company’s local employees’

title: IOS Sagar returns to Kochi with personnel of nine friendly navies, coast guards
content: Having jointly operated the vessel with their Indian counterparts, they and Indian Navy personnel called at five countries in the Indian Ocean Region (IOR) during the past month.

title: Presidency College to double its student intake this academic year
content: The college’s sanctioned intake used to be 1,140 students. But, this academic year they will be admitting another 800 students in the second shift besides 400 more students in the first shift

title: Displaced by Pakistani shelling, residents of border villages long for home and peace
content: Several families of Silikote and Salamabad villages have been shifted to a government college in Uri for their safety even as their residences have been destroyed by mortar shelling from Pakistan side

title: Caste census not a political issue to BJP, but part of a philosophy of social justice, says Dharmendra Pradhan
content: The party has stayed true to its ideological roots by prioritising harmony and empowerment, says Union Minister of Education; the biggest beneficiaries of the Modi government’s welfare policies have been the poor, which includes Muslims as well, and there has been no discrimination, he adds

title: CPI(M) calls for an all-party meeting headed by PM, special session of Parliament
content: The party expressed regret over the absence of Prime Minister Narendra Modi for the second consecutive time in the key all-party meeting

title: India reported 21 lakh additional deaths in 2021 compared with 2020
content: The two lockdown years reported 5,74,198 COVID-19 deaths, says report on births and deaths released  by the Registrar General of India after a gap of five years

title: ‘Ludicrous’ comments made by BJP MP not worthy of contempt action, says Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court termed Nishikant Dubey’s remarks, in which he had attacked the court, “absurd” and displaying a desire and deliberate attempt to malign the court and its judges

title: The two lions and a bear cub that Tamil Nadu’s matinee idol M.G.R. maintained
content: Among the belongings of the actor-turned politician displayed at his memorial house at T. Nagar in Chennai is a taxidermied lion, named Raja. It was bought, along with another cub Rani, in Calcutta by MGR Pictures for some scenes in Nadodi Mannan. Raja died unexpectedly, and Rani was donated to the Chennai Corporation Zoo

title: Seeds, fertilizers available adequately for kharif crops: Chouhan
content: Union Agriculture Minister highlights bumper Kharif output, asserts India has ample seeds and fertilizers; praises Indus Water Treaty cancellation as boost for farmers

title: India Mobilises The "Terriers": What Is Territorial Army - NDTV Explains
content: The Indian Army chief has been given the go-ahead by the government to activate the Territorial Army (TA) to provide for essential guard or in a support role to the regular army. The government's decision comes amid the conflict with Pakistan.

title: Operation Sindoor Live Updates: Centre Reviews Security Apparatus As Pak Chooses Escalation
content: Operation Sindoor Live Updates: India thwarted Pakistan's attempts at targeting 15 places in the country amid rising tension between the two countries, a fallout of the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam on April 22 that killed 26 people.

title: Delhi Tests Air Sirens Amid India-Pak Tensions, 40 More To Be Installed Soon
content: Air raid sirens were heard in the national capital today as part of a mock drill amid escalating tensions between India and Pakistan and two waves of missile and drone attacks from across the border.

title: Over 130 Flights Cancelled At Delhi Airport Due To Airspace Closure
content: As many as 138 flights to and from the Delhi airport were cancelled by various airlines on Friday, according to a source.

title: "We Will Rise Again": J&K Man Whose House Was Destroyed In Pak Shelling
content: The Pahalgam terror attack and the continuous firing by Pakistan across the LoC have taken the residents back to a tense environment filled with anxiety, fear, and uncertainty.

title: NDTV Exclusive: Woman Dead, Daughter Screaming - J&K's Uri Faces Pak Firing
content: In the mountainous Uri sector of Jammu and Kashmir, less than ten kilometres from the Line of Control (LoC), the family of 45-year-old Nargis Bano is devastated by her loss.

title: "Let's Not Bring Their Morale Down": Supreme Court On Women Army Officers
content: The Supreme Court on Friday asked the Centre not to release from service Short Service Commission women Army officers challenging the denial of permanent commission to them asking not to "bring their morale down" in "the prevailing situation".

title: Devendra Fadnavis Chairs Key Security Meet Amid India-Pakistan Tensions
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis Friday chaired a key meeting on internal security amid rising tensions between India and Pakistan following a deadly terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam last month.

title: PM Modi Pays Tribute To Rabindranath Tagore On His 164th Birth Anniversary
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday paid tributes to Nobel laureate Rabindranath Tagore on his birth anniversary, saying his works emphasised on humanism and at the same time ignited the spirit of nationalism among the people.

title: PM Modi Conveys Felicitations To Pope Leo XIV From People Of India
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday conveyed felicitations and best wishes from the people of India to Pope Leo XIV, and said India remains committed to continued dialogue and engagement with the Holy See to further shared values.

title: "Wanted To Show All Parents That...": Tokyo Man After Knife Attack Near Varsity
content: A knife-wielding man arrested in Tokyo this week wanted to warn parents nationwide that tough love can ruin their children, citing his own miserable childhood, Japanese media reported Friday.

title: Mamata Banerjee Pays Tribute To Rabindranath Tagore On His 164th Birth Anniversary
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Friday paid tribute to Rabindranath Tagore on his 164th birth anniversary, and said the Nobel laureate's creations have been illuminating the whole world.

title: "Look Who's Behind Him": Indian Envoy's Photo Proof Of Pak-Sponsored Terror
content: India's High Commissioner to the United Kingdom, Vikram Doraiswami, held up what he described as undeniable evidence of Pakistan's complicity in sponsoring terrorism.

title: "First Saw Twins Playing, Then Found Bodies": Mehbooba Mufti Breaks Down
content: Former Jammu & Kashmir Chief Minister Mehbooba Mufti broke down on Friday over the deaths of children during unprovoked firing by Pakistan.

title: Fake News Alert: Sukhoi Shot Down In POK? Centre Fact-Checks Pak Propaganda
content: Pakistan-based social media handles are spreading fake news that an Indian fighter jet was shot down and its pilot was captured in Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (POK), the government has warned.

title: 6 Military Personnel Dead In Sri Lanka Helicopter Crash
content: Sri Lanka Air Force Bell 212 crashed into the reservoir in the north central region of Maduru Oya, the Ministry of Defence said.

title: US, China To Meet For Talks On Tariff War. A Look At Where Things Currently Stand
content: US and Chinese officials meet this weekend in Geneva for their first formal talks aimed at resolving a gruelling tit-for-tat tariff war that threatens hundreds of billions in trade and roiled global markets and supply chains.

title: Indo-Pak Tensions: JP Nadda Reviews Health Infrastructure
content: Union Health Minister JP Nadda on Friday reviewed health infrastructure preparedness across hospitals in the country amid the ongoing India-Pakistan military conflict, official sources said.

title: Amit Shah Reviews Security Along Indo-Pak Border, Airports With Top Officials
content: Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday reviewed the prevailing situation along India's border with Pakistan and airports in the country amid the military conflict between the two countries, sources said.

title: Pak's Disinformation Campaign Continues, How Their Media Is Twisting Truth
content: The Indian government's official fact-checking agency has been debunking the Pakistani media claims on social media.

title: NBA conference semifinals: Wolves take Game 2 over Warriors
content: the second round of the 2025 playoffs is here, and our insiders have you covered for every game of the Eastern and Western conference semifinals . the no. 4 seed Indiana Pacers kicked off the East semis by taking home-court advantage away from the Cleveland Cavaliers with a 121-112 victory .

title: Enter Sandman: Metallica brings seismic shift to Virginia Tech stadium
content: over 60,000 fans gathered at Virginia Tech's Lane Stadium for a night that created ground tremors . the iconic metal band finally brought their song "Enter Sandman" in front of this dedicated fan base . it was so well-received that it brought a seismic shift to the stadium .

title: Arsenal can't shake nearly-men tag as PSG's collective wins out
content: Paris Saint-Germain will face internazionale in the UEFA champions league final on may 31 . fabián Ruiz's first-half goal and Achraf Hakimi's strike in the second half put PSG on course for the final in Munich . Bukayo Saka 's 76th-minute goal gave the Gunners hope of a late comeback .

title: Missing stars and missed 3s: Why the Cavs and Celtics are suddenly in massive holes
content: the Cleveland Cavaliers and Boston Celtics each won 60-plus games . there's no precedent in league history for what we saw in the opening days of the conference semifinals . a week ago, the playoffs ended with a 2-0 lead over the san francisco pacers .

title: Expert picks, best bets: What's Della Maddalena's path to a title win?
content: welterweight champion belal Muhammad is ranked no. 10 on ESPN's pound-for-pound list . he is unbeaten inside the Octagon, reeling off seven consecutive wins . women's flyweight champion Valentina Shevchenko puts her belt on the line against manon Fiorot .

title: Ranking the top 25 WNBA players: Wilson No. 1, but where do Collier, Stewart, Clark land?
content: the 2025 WNBA season is here, with preseason games underway and the regular season set to tip May 16 . a'ja Wilson and the Las Vegas Aces have a bit of a new look but remain confident in their core . caitlin Clark is looking to lead the Indiana Fever into title contention .
